channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7380] [replication] When transferring queues, check if the peer still exists before copying the znodes
item.description:
Right now it's a pain if you remove a peer and still have rogue queues because they get moved on and on and on. NodeFailoverWorker needs to run the check:

if (!zkHelper.getPeerClusters().containsKey(src.getPeerClusterId())) {

before this:

SortedMap<String, SortedSet<String>> newQueues = zkHelper.copyQueuesFromRS(rsZnode);

And test.
item.summary: [replication] When transferring queues, check if the peer still exists before copying the znodes

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Here's a 0.94 patch.

For 0.96 I'm not sure how to go about this. Chris Trezzo, it seems that I would need to put this in ReplicationQueuesZKImpl but it has no clue regarding peers. Would it make sense to put peerExists() in ReplicationStateZKBase?

Jean-Daniel Cryans I would agree. Since peerExists() is not exposed through an interface, and it doesn't depend on any functionality in ReplicationPeersZKImpl, it seems like ReplicationStateZKBase would be a good place for it.

I posted a patch yesterday on rb: https://reviews.apache.org/r/11014/

It's much different from the one I posted for 0.94 as I saw that it was wrong.
Jean-Daniel Cryans I made some comments on RB. In general it looks good.
Attaching the patch that Chris Trezzo +1'd up on rb for a jenkins run.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12583346/HBASE-7380-v3.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5703//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5703//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html

Committed to 0.95 and trunk, thanks for the reviews Chris!
